com.socialnetwork

Class SoftwareChallenge

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.socialnetwork.SoftwareChallenge

  • public class SoftwareChallenge
extends java.lang.Object
    SoftwareChallenge class implements an application that parses the database file, creating a list of Person. It prints out the total number of people and waits for a user to enter two names. It then computes the distance between the two people.

    • Method Detail

      • parseDB

        public static int parseDB(java.lang.String db_path)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Parses the database specified into the ArrayList people. To quickly check if a person is already in the list, it uses the HashMap peopleMap. The names in the DB must follow the format: NAME1<NAME_SPLIT>SURNAME1<PERSON_SPLIT>NAME2<NAME_SPLIT>SURNAME2
        Parameters:
        db_path - is the path where the database file is found
        Returns:
        the total number of lines parsed aka the lines in the database
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • printFriends

        public static void printFriends()
        Prints on the console the friends of each person.

      • distance

        public static int distance(Person foundPerson)
        Computes the distance from the person specified as parameter and the root.
        Parameters:
        foundPerson - is the person, must have the "previous" field set in order to compute distance
        Returns:
        the distance between the person and the root

      • distance

        public static int distance(Person source,
                           Person target)
        Computes the minimum distance, as number of friends, that separates the two people specified. It exploits the breadth-first searching algorithm.
        Parameters:
        source - is the first person
        target - is the second person
        Returns:
        the distance between source and target, in terms of friends.

      • bfSearch

        public static Person bfSearch(Person source,
                              Person target)
        It searches the specified target person, starting from the specified source person. It exploits graph theory, by searching the graph that represents the people connections according to the breadth-first algorithm. It starts from source and scans all its neighbour first, same for the next iteration and so on.
        Parameters:
        source - is the search starting point
        target - is the target of the search
        Returns:
        the target Person, with the field "previous" set, in order to find the path towards the source

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
